revised_title: Inositol Lipids and Transmembrane Signaling in Fibroblast Growth
tldr: This article discusses the role of inositol lipid breakdown in the control of fibroblast cell proliferation. The authors study the signaling pathways initiated by growth factors in fibroblastic cells and find that thrombin and serotonin activate inositol lipid breakdown, while other mitogens like EGF, FGF, and PDGF do not. The study also shows that these mitogens recognize receptor-tyrosine kinases, suggesting a possible cross-communication between the inositol-lipid pathway and receptor-tyrosine kinases.
